descript.abstract:
The Operational Significant Event Imagery (OSEI) team of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) produces high-resolution, detailed imagery of significant environmental events which are visible in remotely-sensed data available at the NOAA Science Center in Suitland, Maryland. These events include dust storms, fire events, flood events, iceberg events, ocean events, severe weather, tropical storms, snow cover, storm systems, tropical cyclones, hurricanes, and typhoons, and volcano events.
OSEI produces a Daily Operational Significant Event Imagery Report (DOSEIR) which outlines the events that the team has captured in satellite imagery. The report provides a direct link to each image and describes each image with a short narrative. The report is available Monday through Friday as an email via subscription or on the OSEI web site at [http://www.osei.noaa.gov/].
At the OSEI web site, there are links to subdirectories for each category of event tracked by OSEI. Users can download images and access imagery archives from these subdirectories. OSEI occasionally creates special coverage pages that follow particularly significant events and best of OSEI pages which showcase some of the more striking imagery.

distinfo.resdesc: Operational Significant Event Imagery Archive. Available online at [http://www.osei.noaa.gov/] from the Operational Significant Event Imagery (OSEI) support team and the Environmental Applications Team (EAT) of the Satellite Services Division (SSD), National Environmental Satellite, Data, and Information Service (NESDIS), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), Suitland, Maryland, USA.

Data_Set_Link.Label: Daily Operational Significant Event Imagery Report (DOSEIR)
Data_Set_Link.Link_Note: Significant events identified by Satellite Analysis Branch meteorologists and reviewed by OSEI support team are posted daily here.

Data_Set_Link.Label: Current Events Imagery
Data_Set_Link.Link_Note: New imagery for all event categories is posted here daily. The first three letters of the file name correspond to the thematic event category. See the note for each event (below) for the corresponding acronym(s). Files are one of three file types: (1) OSEI Standard format image (saved at full resolution and at high image quality); (2) OSEI Preview format (image is reduced dimensionally before saving; i.e., thumbnails); and (3) OSEI AVI-format or MPG-format animations.

Data_Set_Link.Label: Dust Storms Imagery
Data_Set_Link.Link_Note: OSEI dust storm products include multichannel color composite imagery and animations of meso- to large-scale dust storm events (DST).

Data_Set_Link.Label: Fire Events Imagery
Data_Set_Link.Link_Note: OSEI fire products include multichannel color composite imagery and single-channel grayscale imagery of wildfire and controlled burn events. Products in this event group show smoke (FSM), hotspots (FHS) or both (FSMHS) from the fires.

Data_Set_Link.Label: Flood Events Imagery
Data_Set_Link.Link_Note: OSEI flood products (FLD) include multichannel color composite imagery and single-channel grayscale imagery of enlarged river areas or increased sediment flow. Typically, these events are displayed by comparison to imagery taken when flooding was not occurring.

Data_Set_Link.Label: Icebergs Imagery
Data_Set_Link.Link_Note: OSEI ice products (ICE) include single-channel grayscale imagery and, occasionally, multichannel color composite imagery showing icebergs in the open water or as separations on the edges of ice shelves.

Data_Set_Link.Label: Ocean Events Imagery
Data_Set_Link.Link_Note: OSEI ocean products (OCE) typically include sea surface temperature plots, especially when a large event (such as a hurricane) causes a disruption in the normal temperature distribution, and single-channel imagery of oil spills.

Data_Set_Link.Label: Severe Weather Imagery
Data_Set_Link.Link_Note: OSEI severe weather products (SVR) include multichannel color composite imagery and animations of severe thunderstorms or thunderstorm complexes as seen from both polar (N4, N5) and geostationary (G8, G10) satellites.

Data_Set_Link.Label: Snow Cover Imagery
Data_Set_Link.Link_Note: OSEI snow cover products (SNW) include multichannel color composite imagery showing snow cover, usually after a significant storm system has passed or when snow cover amounts change rapidly because of unseasonably warm weather.

Data_Set_Link.Label: Storm Events Imagery
Data_Set_Link.Link_Note: SEI storm products (STM) include multichannel color composite imagery and animations of large-scale storm systems affecting land areas in the mid-latitudes. This data is obtained from the polar (N4, N5, N6) and geostationary (G8, G10) satellites.

Data_Set_Link.Label: Tropical Events Imagery
Data_Set_Link.Link_Note: OSEI tropical cyclone products (TRC) include multichannel color composite imagery and animations of tropical cyclones at different stages of development from polar (N4, N5, N6) and geostationary (G8, G10) satellites.

Data_Set_Link.Label: Unique Imagery
Data_Set_Link.Link_Note: Products that are not easily classifiable into established event directories are presented here as Unique imagery. This section includes imagery of dense fog/smog, full-disk imagery of the Earth, and imagery from total solar eclipses.

Data_Set_Link.Label: Volcano Events Imagery
Data_Set_Link.Link_Note: OSEI volcano products include multichannel color composite imagery showing ash clouds (VSH), hotspots from lava flow (VIR)or both (VOL). OSEI also creates grayscale split-window images which use a channel differencing technique that enhances the appearance of ash clouds in imagery (DIF). This technique is often useful for distinguishing ash clouds from water vapor clouds.
